name: Joyce Weisbecker, Carol Shaw,  Janese Swanson
name-long: Joyce Weisbecker, Carol Shaw,  Janese Swanson

anecdotes.title: Working at RCA
anecdotes.body: In 1976 after graduating high school, Joyce designed a simple quiz game as a contract employee at The RCA Studio where her father worked.  However, her work was never released on RCA's console and was eclipsed by Atari's VCS and Magnavox's Odyssey, making it a massive failure for RCA's home entertainment division.

anecdotes.title: Successful Design
anecdotes.body: Two years later in 1978, Carol Shaw, the first female game designer at Atari, designed the games Polo (unreleased) and 3-D Tic-Tac-Toe.  Later Carol joined Activision, where she programmed her best-known game, River Raid.

anecdotes.title: Educational Developments
anecdotes.body: In the late 1980s, Janese Swanson co-developed the first of the Carmen Sandiego educational games.  In 1995, she also founded the company Girl Tech, a company that created toys specifically for girls.
